definition: Rocky Mountains in West US and Canada
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Fortunately, most of our water supply is renewed annually as snowpack in the Rockies.
sentences.chinese: 幸運的是，我們大部分的供水續簽每年積雪的落基山。

sentences.english: It is famous for the Rocky Mountains and Niagara Falls.
sentences.chinese: 它因落基山和尼亞加拉瀑布而出名。

sentences.english: She lived in many places, but she says nothing can rival the beauty of the Rocky Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 她住過許多地方，但是她說落基山的美“無與倫比”。

sentences.english: Rocky Mountain spotted fever is a rickettsial disease that occurs in dogs and humans.
sentences.chinese: 落基山斑疹熱是一種人犬共患的立克次體病。

sentences.english: So, it's good we decided to come to the Rocky Mountains for vacation.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我們決定來落基山度假是很好的。

definition: Rocky Mountains/also written 洛磯山|洛矶山
Alberta province of Canada, capital Edmonton 埃德蒙頓|埃德蒙顿[Ai1 de2 meng2 dun4]/also written 阿爾伯塔|阿尔伯塔[A1 er3 bo2 ta3]
Mt Cook on New Zealand South Island, national park and highest peak
Lake Ontario, one of the Great Lakes 五大湖[Wu3 da4 hu2]

pinyin: Ni2 ya4 jia1 la1 Pu4 bu4
